Name: Establishing a climate migrant services coordinator.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a climate migrant services coordinator

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection

Summary: This bill would establish a climate migrant services coordinator to provide guidance to individuals who have relocated to New York City after being displaced from their homes by severe weather or natural disaster events.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 1 of Title 3\cf1  of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 3-119.3 to read as follows:\cf0\ul\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf1\'a73-119.3 Climate Migrant Services Coordinator. a. There shall be established a climate migrant services coordinator, to be located in an agency designated by the mayor, who shall provide guidance to individuals who have relocated to the city of New York after being displaced from their homes by severe weather or natural disaster events. \par
b. Such coordinator shall, at minimum, coordinate among appropriate city, state, and federal agencies and other relevant organizations to \cf0 conduct outreach to identify such individuals and \cf1 identify and coordinate the legal and social services needs of such individuals, including but not limited to: \cf0\par
\cf1 1. Disaster relief claim assistance;\par
2. Case management;\par
3. Assistance in applying for local, state, or federal benefits;\par
4. Immigration legal services;\par
5. Mental health support;\par
6. Long-term healthcare access;\par
7. Nutrition assistance;\par
8. Housing assistance;\par
9. Workforce development; and \par
10. Youth and adult education programs. \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0\ulnone\'a7 2.    This local law takes effect within 60 days after it becomes law.\par
